intro: Ziziphus mirzaporiensis, commonly known as the Mirzapur date palm, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces small, edible fruits that are often used in traditional medicine and local cuisines. It thrives in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting well to poor soil conditions. Due to its ecological and cultural significance, it is also valued for its role in supporting local biodiversity.
